Description: Small pottery lekythos. Cream clay, fired light orange at core, slightly gritty (traces of lime etc). Ovoid body with sloping shoulder, concave tubular neck, high convex rim-moulding (slightly offset), low spreading foot. Tiny handle from neck to shoulder. Fairly careful finish, undecorated. Copy of 5th-4th century BC Attic Greek shape.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 168, no. 212)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.18)
